p: The evaluation indexes of development of C. elegans include three aspects: body length, body width and abnormal development. Changes of body length reflect the growth rate and physiological state of C. elegans. In this study, we chose body length as a development evaluation indicator. Prolonged exposure to 0.25 mg/mL of PHS did not obviously influence the body length of C. elegans, but prolonged exposure to 0.50, 1.00 mg/mL of PHS significantly reduced the body length of C. elegans (Fig. 1c) .
